snippet: Early detection of cancer helps some patients but not others.
abstract: Editorial explains why seemingly conflicting reports issued by federal advisory committees on effectiveness of getting tested regularly for cancer are in fact both right; contends recommendations from both groups come with uncertainties and unanswered questions and burden is on patients and their doctors to decide whether to get early screening for various cancers.
lead_paragraph: Early detection of cancer helps some patients but not others.

keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force
keywords.name: organizations
